meanings.definition: Capable of being cut or divided
meanings.sent1: The scissile paper easily tore in half.
meanings.sent2: She used the scissile blade to trim the edges of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The scissile ribbon split perfectly down the middle.
meanings.sent4: His scissile skills in woodworking made him a master craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The scissile fabric fluttered in the wind, revealing its delicate nature.

meanings.definition: Able to be split or separated
meanings.sent1: The scissile cookie broke into two pieces.
meanings.sent2: The scissile rock split easily under the pressure.
meanings.sent3: The scissile puzzle pieces fit together effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Their scissile relationship finally came to an end.
meanings.sent5: The scissile banana peeled open to reveal its ripe fruit.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to be easily broken into parts
meanings.sent1: The scissile chocolate bar snapped in half.
meanings.sent2: The scissile toy could be taken apart and put back together.
meanings.sent3: The scissile cookie crumbled into delicious pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her scissile necklace chain broke unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The scissile ice sculpture melted into separate droplets.
